title: Towards a Unified Framework for Adaptable Problematic Content Detection via Continual Learning. (arXiv:2309.16905v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: Detecting problematic content, such as hate speech, is a multifaceted and ever-changing task, influenced by social dynamics, user populations, diversity of sources, and evolving language. There has been significant efforts, both in academia and in industry, to develop annotated resources that capture various aspects of problematic content. Due to researchers' diverse objectives, the annotations are inconsistent and hence, reports of progress on detection of problematic content are fragmented. This pattern is expected to persist unless we consolidate resources considering the dynamic nature of the problem. We propose integrating the available resources, and leveraging their dynamic nature to break this pattern. In this paper, we introduce a continual learning benchmark and framework for problematic content detection comprising over 84 related tasks encompassing 15 annotation schemas from 8 sources. Our benchmark creates a novel measure of progress: prioritizing the adaptability of class

translated_title: 通过连续学习实现适应性问题内容检测的统一框架
translated_abstract: 检测问题内容，例如仇恨言论，是一项多方面且不断变化的任务，受社会动态、用户群体、信息来源的多样性和语言的演变影响。学术界和业界都进行了大量努力，开发出捕捉问题内容各个方面的注释资源。由于研究人员的不同目标，这些注释是不一致的，因此对于检测问题内容的进展报告是分散的。除非我们考虑问题的动态性，否则这种模式预计会持续存在。我们提出整合现有资源，并利用其动态特性打破这种模式。在本文中，我们引入了一个连续学习基准和框架，用于问题内容检测，包括来自8个来源的15个注释架构的84个相关任务。我们的基准创建了一种新的进展度量：优先考虑类别适应性。
tldr: 本文提出了一个统一框架，通过连续学习来适应性地检测问题内容。该框架整合了来自8个来源的15个注释架构的84个相关任务，并创建了一种新的进展度量标准：优先考虑类别适应性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a unified framework for adaptable problematic content detection through continual learning. The framework integrates 84 related tasks with 15 annotation schemas from 8 sources, and introduces a novel measure of progress by prioritizing class adaptability.
